intro: Cameraria tamaquarina, commonly known as the Tamaquara leafminer, is a small moth species belonging to the family Lyonetiidae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The larvae of this species feed on the leaves of the Tamaquara tree, which is a type of palm known as Attalea maripa. The plant's leaves are broad and fan-shaped, providing a habitat for various insects and contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem. The interaction between Cameraria tamaquarina and its host plant is an example of a specialized herbivory relationship in tropical flora.
